description: TypeC or TypeD port switch trap.
The first ifIndex is the active one after switching over.
The second ifIndex is the standby one after switching over.

event.Summary: TypeC or TypeD port switchover alarm occurred

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwXponnniPortSwitchTrap HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwReservedValue i 9999 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: Reserved value.
variables.name: HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwReservedValue

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Port type adaptation fault alarm trap.
This trap message is generated when the uplink port on the ONU is set to work in adaptive mode
the type of the OLT downlink port transmitting the optical signal is different from the type of
the uplink port on the ONU. As a result, the uplink port on the ONU is faulty.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortTypeAdaptFaultAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortHostmode i 7 HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortActualmode i 7

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: The port host mode.
Options:
1. geMode(7) - Ge mode
2. adaptMode(27) - Adapt mode
3. gponMode(114) - Gpon mode
4. eponMode(115) - Epon mode
variables.name: HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortHostmode

description: The port actual mode.
Options:
1. geMode(7) - Ge mode
2. adaptMode(27) - Adapt mode
3. gponMode(114) - Gpon mode
4. eponMode(115) - Epon mode
variables.name: HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortActualmode

description: Port type adaptation fault recovery alarm trap.
This trap message is generated when the uplink port on the ONU is set to work in adaptive mode,
the type of the OLT downlink port transmitting the optical signal is the same as the type of
the uplink port on the ONU, and the service on the uplink port is restored.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortTypeAdaptFaultRestoreAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortHostmode i 7 HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortActualmode i 7

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.

variables.name: HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortActualmode

description: Port type adaptation success alarm trap.
This trap message is generated when the type of the OLT downlink port transmitting the optical signal changes,
the adaptation of the uplink port on the ONU is successful.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortTypeAdaptSuccessAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortHostmode i 7 HUAWEI-LINE-COMMON-MIB::hwPortActualmode i 7

description: Protection switchover occurs on the PON port and it has no effect on the service.
The first hwPortIndex is the source port index
the second hwPortIndex is the destination port index.

event.Summary: PON port $v3 protection switchover occurred with no service impact
